content:
The "Small Business Tax Modernization Act of 2008" includes a standard deduction for business use of home. The "Small Business Tax Modernization Act of 2008" introduces a standard home office deduction for individuals using their home for business purposes. The standard home office deduction introduced by the "Small Business Tax Modernization Act of 2008" is the lesser of $2,000 or the gross income from the individual's business. There is also a provision for inflation adjustment in the dollar amount for taxable years after 2008. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007, shall be determined by substituting '2007' for '1992' in the calculation, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. SEC. 3. DE MINIMIS EXCEPTION TO EXCLUSIVE USE REQUIREMENT. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for a de minimis nonbusiness use exception for personal use of a home office, making accounting for small personal use unreasonable. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code removes cellular phones and similar telecommunications equipment from listed property. Effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2007.

SEC. 5. Nonresident aliens allowed to be S corporation shareholders. Effective for taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act. Increased deduction of business meals and entertainment expenses for qualified small businesses. Increased deduction of business meals and entertainment expenses for qualified small businesses. Subsection (n) of section 274 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow qualified small businesses to deduct 75 percent for taxable years beginning in 2008 and 80 percent for taxable years beginning after 2008. A qualified small business is defined for this purpose. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007 for corporations, partnerships, and sole proprietorships meeting the gross receipts test. SEC. 7 outlines the recovery period for depreciation of certain systems installed in nonresidential and residential rental buildings. The 20-year recovery period for highly efficient HVAC&R equipment is amended to include initial land improvements for electric utility transmission and distribution plants, as well as properties part of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, or commercial refrigeration systems exceeding the minimum threshold by at least 10 percent. The 20-year recovery period for highly efficient HVAC&R equipment is amended to include properties exceeding the minimum threshold by at least 10 percent, installed in nonresidential or residential rental buildings. The 20-year recovery period for highly efficient HVAC&R equipment is amended to include properties exceeding the minimum threshold by at least 10 percent, installed in nonresidential or residential rental buildings. Additionally, a 25-year recovery period is established for certain HVAC&R equipment that is part of a heating, ventilation, air conditioning, or commercial refrigeration system, installed in nonresidential real property before January 1, 2012. The 20-year recovery period for highly efficient HVAC&R equipment is amended to include properties exceeding the minimum threshold by at least 10 percent, installed in nonresidential or residential rental buildings. A 25-year recovery period is established for certain HVAC&R equipment that is part of a heating, ventilation, air conditioning, or commercial refrigeration system, installed in nonresidential real property before January 1, 2012. Amendments are made to the tax code regarding the classification of properties for depreciation purposes. Amendments are made to the tax code regarding the classification of properties for depreciation purposes, including establishing a 25-year recovery period for certain HVAC&R equipment in nonresidential real property. The amendments made by this section establish a 25-year recovery period for certain HVAC&R equipment in nonresidential real property, effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2007.
